i.name: Prophet of an Elder God
i.description: Illaoi and the <font color='#669900'>Vessels</font> she creates spawn Tentacles on nearby impassible terrain. Tentacles swing at spirits, <font color='#669900'>Vessels</font>, and victims of Illaoi's Harsh lesson. Tentacles deal physical damage to enemies hit, and will heal Illaoi if they damage a champion.

q.name: Tentacle Smash
q.description: Increases the damage dealt by Tentacles. When activated, Illaoi smashes down a Tentacle that deals physical damage.

w.name: Harsh Lesson
w.description: Illaoi leaps to her target, dealing physical damage and causing nearby Tentacles to also swing at the target.

e.name: Test of Spirit
e.description: Illaoi rips the spirit from a foe's body, forcing it to stand before her. Spirits echo a percentage of the damage they take to the original target. If killed, or if the target gets too far from the spirit, the target will become a <font color='#669900'>Vessel</font> and begin spawning Tentacles.

r.name: Leap of Faith
r.description: Illaoi smashes her idol into the ground, dealing physical damage to nearby enemies. A Tentacle spawns for each enemy champion hit.

i1.blurb: Illaoi and the Vessels she creates spawn Tentacles on nearby impassible terrain. Tentacles swing at spirits, Vessels, and victims of Illaoi's Harsh lesson. Tentacles deal physical damage to enemies hit, and will heal Illaoi if they damage a champion.
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Illaoi''' periodically spawns a '''''{{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}}''''' on nearby impassable terrain if no Tentacles are {{tt|nearby|1000 range}}, which remains on the battlefield until killed or when disabled for 60 seconds.

'''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}''''' deal {{pp|10 to 180}} {{as|(+ 120% AD)|AD}} {{tip|Physical Damage|{{as|physical damage}}}} when commanded to attack by her abilities. Each '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}''''' also {{tip|heal|heals}} '''Illaoi''' for {{as|5% '''missing''' health}} if it hits at least one enemy {{tip|champion}} (See [[#Pets|Pet Details]] for more).
i1.name: Prophet of an Elder God
notes: * '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}''''' do not spawn in the [[Nexus Obelisk|Nexus Obelisk's]] attack range.
* Impassable terrain also includes player-made terrain and terrain that is passable by a team but not by the other, for example base gates.

* '''Illaoi''' has infinite range from which she can spawn a '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}'''''. However, if she’s in an area near a spawned '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}''''', she must leave it if she wants to spawn another one.
* They take about 2 seconds to finish their spawn animation.

* The '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}''''' will continue its spawn animation and be able to start an attack, after the animation ends, even if '''Illaoi''' or a '''''{{as|Vessel|buzzword2}}''''' are not nearby.
* If '''Illaoi''' uses ''{{ai|Harsh Lesson}}'' during '''''{{as|Tentacles'|buzzword}}''''' spawn animation, they won't attack but the SFX of the attack will still be heard.
** If this happens, after the '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}''''' finishes its spawn animation, it will be unable to start an attack for its remaining attack SFX.

riot.name: Prophet of an Elder God
riot.description: Illaoi and the <font color='#669900'>Vessels</font> she creates spawn Tentacles on nearby impassible terrain. Tentacles swing at spirits, <font color='#669900'>Vessels</font>, and victims of Illaoi's Harsh lesson. Tentacles deal physical damage to enemies hit, and will heal Illaoi if they damage a champion.

riot.name: Tentacle Smash
riot.description: Increases the damage dealt by Tentacles. When activated, Illaoi smashes down a Tentacle that deals physical damage.
riot.tooltip:
Passive: Slam damage is increased by {{ e6 }}% ({{ f1 }}).

Active: Illaoi swings her idol, causing a Tentacle to Slam forward.

q1.blurb: Increases the damage dealt by Tentacles. When activated, Illaoi smashes down a Tentacle that deals physical damage.
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''''{{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}}}''''' deal increased damage.

{{sbc|Active:}} '''Illaoi''' slams her {{ai|Harsh Lesson||idol}} into the ground, summoning a '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}''''' that slams down in the target direction, dealing {{as|physical damage}} before disappearing.
q1.name: Tentacle Smash
notes: * Getting {{tip|airborne|displaced}} during the cast time will not change the indicator on the ground, but it will change the damaged area, while still being directed towards the previous pointed location.
* If '''Illaoi''' is not {{tip|sight|visible}}, the slam will be seen but it will not be heard.

riot.name: Harsh Lesson
riot.description: Illaoi leaps to her target, dealing physical damage and causing nearby Tentacles to also swing at the target.
riot.tooltip:
Illaoi leaps at her target on her next basic attack, dealing bonus physical damage equal to {{ f1*100 }}% of their maximum health [{{ e1 }}% + {{ f2*100 }}% per 100 attack damage].

When she strikes, nearby Tentacles will Slam at the target.

Harsh Lesson's bonus damage against monsters is capped at {{ e3 }} damage per hit.

w1.blurb: Illaoi leaps to her target, dealing physical damage and causing nearby Tentacles to also swing at the target.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Illaoi's''' next [[basic attack]] within 6 seconds gains {{sti|range|225 '''bonus''' range}} and causes her to {{tip|dash|leap}} to her target if it's not inside her base attack range, dealing {{as|'''bonus''' physical damage}} (Capped at 300 against non-champions) and commanding all '''''{{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}}}''''' in range to attack her target.
leveling: {{st|Bonus Physical Damage|{{as|{{ap|3 to 5}}% {{as|(+ 2% per 100 AD)}} of target's '''maximum''' health|health}}}}
w1.name: Harsh Lesson
notes: * It will not affect structures, but the enhanced attack will be consumed.
* The attack will break {{tip|spell shield|spell shields}} but it will not prevent the damage or '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}''''' slam.
* The attack will apply [[Ability effects|spell effects]] and the bonus damage will heal from {{sti|spell vamp}}.
** Since the attack applies both on-hit effects and spell effects it will trigger {{ii|Muramana}} twice.
* ''Harsh Lesson'' is made of two different abilities which are decided by '''Illaoi''' being close to the target or in dash range.
* The close range one:

** It's {{tip|unstoppable}}, meaning no effect can interrupt it other than death, '''Illaoi's''' or the target's. Using {{si|Flash}} or {{ii|Zhonya's Hourglass}} will cancel the animation but the attack will still land.
** Starting the attack before getting in {{iis|Guardian Angel}} passive and hitting while she's in it will not make '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}''''' slam.
** Starting the attack before the target becomes {{tip|untargetable}} will still make '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}''''' slam on the target.
** Does trigger {{ri|Hail of Blades}}.
** While {{ii|Spear of Shojin|Awakened}}, the '''Harsh Lesson''' empowered basic attack will reduce '''Harsh Lesson's''' cooldown.
** Using it at the same time with {{ii|Ravenous Hydra}} will perform an unusual dunk.
* The dash range one:
** It's not unstoppable, meaning that effects can interrupt it during the dash and put it cooldown. {{si|Flash}} and {{ii|Zhonya's Hourglass}} cannot be used during the dash.
** Starting the attack before the target becomes {{tip|untargetable}} will not make '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}''''' slam.
** Does not trigger {{ri|Hail of Blades}}.
** While {{ii|Spear of Shojin|Awakened}}, the '''Harsh Lesson''' empowered basic attack will not reduce '''Harsh Lesson's''' cooldown.
** The attack will trigger {{nie|Energized}} effects before the attack actually hits.
** She can still {{tip|dash}} even if she's {{tip|root|rooted}}.
** Having enough attack speed will perform an unusual dunk.
** Having increased size will increase the range of her ''Harsh Lesson'' but the indicator range will not change.
* If the target dies at the moment ''Harsh Lesson'' hits the target, it will be consumed and put on cooldown, without making '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}''''' slam.
* Each parry has different interactions with this ability:
** {{ai|Counter Strike|Jax}}: '''does not''' deal damage and '''does not''' proc the {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}} slam.
** {{ai|Aegis Protection|Pantheon}} and {{ai|Spirit's Refuge|Shen}}:
*** Close range: '''does not''' deal damage but '''does''' proc the {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}} slam.
*** Dash range: '''does not''' deal damage and '''does not''' proc the {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}} slam.
** {{ai|Blinding Dart|Teemo}}:
*** Close range: '''does not''' deal damage and '''does not''' proc the {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}} slam.
*** Dash range: '''does''' deal damage and '''does''' proc the {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}} slam.
* While {{tip|ground|grounded}} '''Illaoi''' will walk into melee range before using this ability.
* Attack moving while charging {{si|Hexflash}} will delay the attack.
* ''Harsh Lesson'' is able to both trigger {{ri|Bone Plating}} and deal reduced damage from it with one attack.

* Using ''Harsh Lesson'' will make every successive auto '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}''''' attack to not get any {{ri|Conqueror}} / {{ri|Electrocute}} / {{ri|Phase Rush}} / {{ii|Spellthief's Edge|Tribute}} stacks.
** This will stop if '''Illaoi''' hits an enemy champion with her ''{{ai|Test of Spirit}}''.
** In ''Conqueror's'' case it will also cause '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}''''' to not refresh the buff duration.

* If an enemy {{ci|Wukong}} uses his {{ai|Nimbus Strike|Wukong}} on the minions there will be a time interval where '''Illaoi''' is able to use her ''Harsh Lesson'' and ''attack move'' to hit the ally minion, without dealing any damage but triggering the '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}''''' slams.

riot.name: Test of Spirit
riot.description: Illaoi rips the spirit from a foe's body, forcing it to stand before her. Spirits echo a percentage of the damage they take to the original target. If killed, or if the target gets too far from the spirit, the target will become a <font color='#669900'>Vessel</font> and begin spawning Tentacles.
riot.tooltip:
Illaoi pulls the spirit from an enemy champion for {{ e3 }} seconds (reduced when Illaoi is attacked by the target). The spirit can be attacked, with {{ e1 }}% (+{{ f5 }}%) of the damage taken echoing to its owner.

If the spirit dies or the target leaves its range, the target becomes a Vessel for {{ e2 }} seconds and is slowed by {{ e8 }}% for {{ e5 }} seconds. Vessels spawn Tentacles every {{ f1 }} seconds if no other Tentacles are nearby.

Tentacles will automatically Slam at spirits and Vessels once every 10 seconds.

e1.blurb: Illaoi rips the spirit from a foe's body, forcing it to stand before her. Spirits echo a percentage of the damage they take to the original target. If killed, or if the target gets too far from the spirit, the target will become a Vessel and begin spawning Tentacles.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Illaoi''' lashes out a tentacle in the target direction that stops at the first enemy struck. If the enemy is a {{tip|champion}}, their '''''{{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}}''''' is pulled in front of '''Illaoi'''. The target is tethered to the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''', and {{tip|true sight|revealed}} while it remains.

The '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''' has the target's {{sti|health|{{as|'''current''' health}}}}, {{sti|{{as|armor}}}} and {{sti|mr|{{as|magic resist}}}}, and remains for 10 seconds, reduced by 1 second each time the target damages '''Illaoi''' (by [[Unit-targeted|single target]] or [[area of effect]]). The '''''{{as|Spirit's|buzzword3}}''''' remaining duration increases by 1 second whenever it levels up. A portion of the pre-mitigation damage dealt to the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''' is forwarded to the tethered champion.

When the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''' is killed or the target moves too far away, the tether is severed, {{tip|slow|slowing}} them by 80% for {{fd|1.5}} seconds and marking them as a '''''{{as|Vessel|buzzword2}}''''' for 12 seconds, {{tip|sight|revealing}} the area around them for a few seconds.
Each {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}} will autonomously attack the closest '''''{{as|Vessel|buzzword2}}''''' / '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''' once every 10 seconds.
{{sbc|Vessel:}} It spawns a '''''{{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}}''''' near it every {{pp|3|5 to 3|1 to 13}} seconds, ceased by {{tip|takedown|taking down}} '''Illaoi'''.
e1.name: Test of Spirit
notes: * '''''{{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirits|buzzword3}}}}''''' are classified as [[Champion summoned units#Decoy|Decoys]].
** The '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''' can only be targeted by '''Illaoi's''' team and neutral monsters--the '''''{{as|Spirit's|buzzword3}}''''' allies cannot target it.
*** Towers will not increase their damage per shot when attacking it, and they will also deal 50% reduced damage to it.

** '''''{{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirits|buzzword3}}}}''''' cannot be {{tip|heal|healed}} or {{tip|shield|shielded}} by most means. The only way to shield them is by taking {{ri|Summon Aery|Aery}} and using a heal that auto targets champions like {{si|Heal}} or {{ai|Wish|Soraka}}. Even if the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} doesn't take any damage because of the shield, the redirected damage still inflicts it.
** It's immune to {{tip|stasis}}.

** The only stat connected to the '''''{{as|Vessel|buzzword2}}''''' is their level. Leveling up is the only way to increase their {{as|health}}, {{as|armor}} and {{as|magic resist}} after it's been pulled out.
** Killing it rewards {{g|25}} and {{as|{{sti|Experience|44}}}}.

* {{tip|Spell shield|Spell shields}} will only prevent your '''''{{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}}''''' from being grabbed. ''Spell shields'' will not prevent you from becoming a '''''{{as|Vessel|buzzword2}}''''' or prevent '''''{{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}}}''''' from attacking you, although they can be used to block a '''''{{as|Tentacle's|buzzword}}''''' attack.

* The tentacle model of the first cast is connected to '''Illaoi's''' body and will stop moving when '''Illaoi''' does (e.g {{tip|stasis}}, {{tip|sleep}}, {{tip|airborne}}). However, the projectile will not, and will be able to hit enemies away from its model position. It will also not be seen by enemies if '''Illaoi''' is not {{tip|Sight|visible}}, but it will be heard if the tentacle passes through their vision.
* Using {{si|Flash}} during the cast time will change '''Illaoi's''' position but the tentacle will still be directed towards the previous pointed location.

* Grabbing the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''' of a champion that doesn't have a manabar (i.e full {{tip|Fury}} or {{tip|Flow}}) will make the '''''{{as|Spirit's|buzzword3}}''''' lifetime (the white bar below the lifebar) disappear.

* Grabbing the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''' of a target that is {{tip|camouflage|camouflaged}} while there’s a control ward revealing them will make the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''' invisible.

* The tentacle will not grab the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''' of {{ci|Sion}} during his {{ai|Glory in Death|Sion}}. However, grabbing it before ''Sion'' initially dies causes the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''' to remain during ''Sion's'' ''Glory in Death'', thus still being able to become a '''''{{as|Vessel|buzzword2}}'''''.
* The target will get slowed only after the tether returns back to it and not instantly.
* Only '''Illaoi''' can see who's been '''''{{as|Vesseled|buzzword2}}'''''.

* Redirected damage is calculated by taking the premitigation damage, applying it to ''Test of Spirit's'' modifier, and then cap it to the '''''{{as|Spirit's|buzzword3}}''''' {{as|'''current''' health}}. This damage will then be affected by damage modifiers of the enemy champion.

** The damage shown being received by the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} is not representative of the damage redirected to the {{as|Vessel|buzzword2}}, as the combat text shown adjacent to the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} factors the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit's|buzzword3}}}} modifiers - which may be different from the {{as|Vessel's|buzzword2}} (e.g different resistances, {{ri|Coup de Grace}}).
*** Stacking {{ri|Press the Attack}} on the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} will only increase the damage against the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} and not against the enemy champion.

** In a hypothetical situation, if both the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} as the target have 50% damage reduction from {{as|armor}}, the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} has {{as|500 HP}}, and it receives 1000 damage (before resistances), while ''Test of Spirit'' has 60% ratio, redirected damage won’t be 1000{{times}}0.6{{times}}0.5{{equals}}300 but it will be 1000{{times}}0.6{{equals}}600, is 600 less than 500 ({{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit's|buzzword3}}}} {{as|'''current''' health}})? No, then redirected damage is 500{{times}}0.5{{equals}}250.
If instead of being dealt 1000 damage in 1 hit, it would've been dealt in 2 hits, 500 each, the results would have been these: 500{{times}}0.6{{equals}}300 less than 500 (Yes) 300{{times}}0.5{{equals}}150 redirected damage (first hit)
In the meantime the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} took 500{{times}}0.5{{equals}}250 damage
Same thing for second hit, 500{{times}}0.6{{equals}}300 less than 250(No) 250{{times}}0.5{{equals}}125 redirected damage (second hit)
The {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} reached {{as|0 HP}} because of having taken 250 damage twice.
Total redirected damage{{equals}}150{{plus}}125{{equals}}275
*** Even if total damage dealt to the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} is the same in both cases, total redirected damage is higher if it's dealt with less powerful attacks.

* Damage transferred to the target will apply damage-type specific effects such as {{ii|The Black Cleaver}}, {{ii|Morellonomicon}}, {{ii|Executioner's Calling}}, or the healing from {{ii|Death's Dance}} / {{ii|Hextech Gunblade}}, determined by who dealt the damage.

** It will not trigger on-hit effects or spell effects versus the target ({{ri|Scorch}}, {{ii|Wit's End}}) although the damage of those effects dealt to the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} will be transferred.
* Attacking both the enemy and its {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} at the same time will have the enemy receive only one {{ii|The Black Cleaver}} stack.

* {{ii|Spellthief's Edge|Tribute}} and {{ri|Predator}} only reflect double bonus damage, not taking into account actual damage done to the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} (e.g if {{ri|Predator}} would deal 60 bonus damage, what would get reflected is 120 damage).

* {{ri|Electrocute}} / {{ri|Phase Rush}} / {{ii|Spellthief's Edge|Tribute}} stacks can be put on the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} but redirected damage won't apply any stack on the enemy champion.

* The redirected damage from triggering {{ri|Conqueror}} on the ''Spirit'' will benefit from the true damage and will be amplified by the bonus ad (the triggered ''Conqueror'' damage usually doesn't benefit from either).
* Attacking the ''Spirit'' with {{ri|Conqueror}} will redirect 19% of the damage as {{tip|true damage}}, before ''Test of Spirit's'' modifier.
* Runes statistics will consider the damage being done to the spirit.

* {{ai|Riposte|Fiora}} can prevent from becoming a {{as|Vessel|buzzword2}} if used before the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} gets killed or while {{ai|Lunge|Fiora|lunging}} out of the tether's range.
* If a champion is made a {{as|Vessel|buzzword2}} while {{ii|Guardian Angel|reviving}}, it will revive without being one.

* If the target becomes a {{as|Vessel|buzzword2}} in a dormant {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle's|buzzword}}}} attack range, that {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}}} will be prevented from doing its first attack.

* Once the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} vanishes (it doesn't need to be killed) '''Illaoi''' will get {{ris|Coup de Grace}} bonus ad, {{iis|Phage|Rage}} full movement speed bonus and 1 creep score in-game (they won't be shown in the end of game chat).

riot.name: Test of Spirit
riot.description: Illaoi rips the spirit from a foe's body, forcing it to stand before her. Spirits echo a percentage of the damage they take to the original target. If killed, or if the target gets too far from the spirit, the target will become a <font color='#669900'>Vessel</font> and begin spawning Tentacles.

If the spirit dies or the target leaves its range, the target becomes a Vessel for {{ e2 }} seconds and is slowed by {{ e8 }}% for {{ e5 }} seconds. Vessels spawn Tentacles every {{ f1 }} seconds if no other Tentacles are nearby.

Tentacles will automatically Slam at spirits and Vessels once every 10 seconds.

{{sbc|Vessel:}} It spawns a '''''{{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}}''''' near it every {{pp|3|5 to 3|1 to 13}} seconds, ceased by {{tip|takedown|taking down}} '''Illaoi'''.

''Spell shields'' will not prevent you from becoming a '''''{{as|Vessel|buzzword2}}''''' or prevent '''''{{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}}}''''' from attacking you, although they can be used to block a '''''{{as|Tentacle's|buzzword}}''''' attack.

However, the projectile will not, and will be able to hit enemies away from its model position. It will also not be seen by enemies if '''Illaoi''' is not {{tip|Sight|visible}}, but it will be heard if the tentacle passes through their vision.

* Grabbing the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''' of a target that is {{tip|camouflage|camouflaged}} while there’s a control ward revealing them will make the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''' invisible.

* The tentacle will not grab the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''' of {{ci|Sion}} during his {{ai|Glory in Death|Sion}}. However, grabbing it before ''Sion'' initially dies causes the '''''{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}''''' to remain during ''Sion's'' ''Glory in Death'', thus still being able to become a '''''{{as|Vessel|buzzword2}}'''''.
* The target will get slowed only after the tether returns back to it and not instantly.
* Only '''Illaoi''' can see who's been '''''{{as|Vesseled|buzzword2}}'''''.

* Redirected damage is calculated by taking the premitigation damage, applying it to ''Test of Spirit's'' modifier, and then cap it to the '''''{{as|Spirit's|buzzword3}}''''' {{as|'''current''' health}}. This damage will then be affected by damage modifiers of the enemy champion.

** The damage shown being received by the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} is not representative of the damage redirected to the {{as|Vessel|buzzword2}}, as the combat text shown adjacent to the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} factors the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit's|buzzword3}}}} modifiers - which may be different from the {{as|Vessel's|buzzword2}} (e.g different resistances, {{ri|Coup de Grace}}).
*** Stacking {{ri|Press the Attack}} on the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} will only increase the damage against the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} and not against the enemy champion.

** In a hypothetical situation, if both the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} as the target have 50% damage reduction from {{as|armor}}, the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} has {{as|500 HP}}, and it receives 1000 damage (before resistances), while ''Test of Spirit'' has 60% ratio, redirected damage won’t be 1000{{times}}0.6{{times}}0.5{{equals}}300 but it will be 1000{{times}}0.6{{equals}}600, is 600 less than 500 ({{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit's|buzzword3}}}} {{as|'''current''' health}})? No, then redirected damage is 500{{times}}0.5{{equals}}250.
If instead of being dealt 1000 damage in 1 hit, it would've been dealt in 2 hits, 500 each, the results would have been these: 500{{times}}0.6{{equals}}300 less than 500 (Yes) 300{{times}}0.5{{equals}}150 redirected damage (first hit)
In the meantime the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} took 500{{times}}0.5{{equals}}250 damage
Same thing for second hit, 500{{times}}0.6{{equals}}300 less than 250(No) 250{{times}}0.5{{equals}}125 redirected damage (second hit)
The {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} reached {{as|0 HP}} because of having taken 250 damage twice.
Total redirected damage{{equals}}150{{plus}}125{{equals}}275
*** Even if total damage dealt to the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} is the same in both cases, total redirected damage is higher if it's dealt with less powerful attacks.

* Damage transferred to the target will apply damage-type specific effects such as {{ii|The Black Cleaver}}, {{ii|Morellonomicon}}, {{ii|Executioner's Calling}}, or the healing from {{ii|Death's Dance}} / {{ii|Hextech Gunblade}}, determined by who dealt the damage.

** It will not trigger on-hit effects or spell effects versus the target ({{ri|Scorch}}, {{ii|Wit's End}}) although the damage of those effects dealt to the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} will be transferred.
* Attacking both the enemy and its {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} at the same time will have the enemy receive only one {{ii|The Black Cleaver}} stack.

* {{ii|Spellthief's Edge|Tribute}} and {{ri|Predator}} only reflect double bonus damage, not taking into account actual damage done to the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} (e.g if {{ri|Predator}} would deal 60 bonus damage, what would get reflected is 120 damage).

* {{ri|Electrocute}} / {{ri|Phase Rush}} / {{ii|Spellthief's Edge|Tribute}} stacks can be put on the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} but redirected damage won't apply any stack on the enemy champion.

* The redirected damage from triggering {{ri|Conqueror}} on the ''Spirit'' will benefit from the true damage and will be amplified by the bonus ad (the triggered ''Conqueror'' damage usually doesn't benefit from either).
* Attacking the ''Spirit'' with {{ri|Conqueror}} will redirect 19% of the damage as {{tip|true damage}}, before ''Test of Spirit's'' modifier.
* Runes statistics will consider the damage being done to the spirit.

* {{ai|Riposte|Fiora}} can prevent from becoming a {{as|Vessel|buzzword2}} if used before the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} gets killed or while {{ai|Lunge|Fiora|lunging}} out of the tether's range.
* If a champion is made a {{as|Vessel|buzzword2}} while {{ii|Guardian Angel|reviving}}, it will revive without being one.

* If the target becomes a {{as|Vessel|buzzword2}} in a dormant {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle's|buzzword}}}} attack range, that {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}}} will be prevented from doing its first attack.

* Once the {{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}} vanishes (it doesn't need to be killed) '''Illaoi''' will get {{ris|Coup de Grace}} bonus ad, {{iis|Phage|Rage}} full movement speed bonus and 1 creep score in-game (they won't be shown in the end of game chat).

riot.name: Leap of Faith
riot.description: Illaoi smashes her idol into the ground, dealing physical damage to nearby enemies. A Tentacle spawns for each enemy champion hit.
riot.tooltip:
Illaoi smashes her idol into the ground, dealing {{ damagecalc }} physical damage to nearby enemies and spawning a Tentacle for each enemy champion hit.

For the next {{ duration }} seconds Tentacles are untargetable and will Slam 50% faster, and Harsh Lesson has a 2 second cooldown.

'There are kind and gentle gods. Mine isn't one of those.'

r1.blurb: Illaoi smashes her idol into the ground, dealing physical damage to nearby enemies. A Tentacle spawns for each enemy champion hit.
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Illaoi''' leaps into the air {{tip|unstoppable|unstoppably}} before slamming her idol into the ground, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to nearby enemies. For each enemy champion and '''''{{ai|Vessel||{{as|Spirit|buzzword3}}}}''''' hit, a '''''{{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}}''''' is summoned for 8 seconds (up to a maximum of 5 summons).

For the duration, {{ais|Harsh Lesson|Illaoi}} {{sti|cooldown}} is halved, all '''''{{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}}}''''' awakened by '''Illaoi''' are {{tip|untargetable}}, will not show their hitboxes, will not go dormant, and will take half the amount of time to make an attack.
r1.flavorsound: {{sm2|Illaoi.move17.ogg|''"There are kind and gentle gods. Mine isn't one of those."''}}
r1.name: Leap of Faith
notes: * '''Illaoi''' is immune to {{tip|stasis}} while in her cast animation.
* {{si|Flash}} can be used during the cast time.
* Other [[Champion summoned units#Decoy|decoys]] are not counted as champions for the '''''{{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}}''''' summoning.

* '''Illaoi''' spawns the '''''{{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}}''''' 850 range away from her, unless there's a natural wall blocking the way making the '''''{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}''''' spawn on it, based on:
** The direction she's facing.
*** She will always face at the nearest {{tip|sight|visible}} enemy champion, in ''Leap of Faith's'' range, the instant she leaps.
*** If there's no enemy champion nearby, she faces in the direction of the cursor.
*** {{si|Flash|Flashing}} mid-animation will change the spawning direction to where the cursor is pointed, regardless of the nearest enemy champion.
** How many champions she hits.
*** 1+ champions: one {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}} at 0 degrees.
*** 2+ champions: one {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}} at 72 degrees.
*** 3+ champions: one {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}} at 288 degrees.
*** 4+ champions: one {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}} at 144 degrees.
*** 5+ champions: one {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}} at 216 degrees.
** If there're no walls nearby, spawning the last {{ai|Prophet of an Elder God||{{as|Tentacle|buzzword}}}} will form a perfect pentagram.
* {{tip|Spell shield|Spell shields}} will block the ability's damage but will not prevent '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}''''' from spawning.
* Activating {{ii|Guardian Angel}} during the leap will not stop the ability from doing damage or spawn '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}'''''.

* Using ''{{ai|Harsh Lesson}}'' after '''Illaoi''' drops down will command '''''{{as|Tentacles|buzzword}}''''' to instantly attack, regardless if they were already attacking. Their old attack will keep on going and will hit while the second attack is on its animation attack.
* Using ''{{ai|Harsh Lesson}}'' an instant before ''Leap of Faith's'' buff finishes will delay the '''''{{as|Tentacle's|buzzword}}''''' attack.
